page.title: 15FINZEAN HOUSING DEVELOPMENT.
page.content: The Finzean estate had built most of its houses during the{19th century}and very little new building took placxe until recently, principally because the laird was forbidden to sell any land from the entailed estate until 1935, when Joseph Farquharson died. The land had then to be disentailed to pay death duties. {Some ten new houses}have been built recently, mostly by young Feughside newly-weds who, hopefully ,will bring up their families in the valley.{Some {estate houses have also been sold, either to the sitting tenants or to outside people. It is the policy of the Farquharsons to cut down on the burden of keeping up surplus buildings at a time of high inflation, since {rental income does not adequately meet {the necessary expenditure.
